intro: Hexaphylla capitata, commonly known as the clustered leaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in disturbed areas. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a distinctive, lobed shape. It produces yellowish-green flowers in dense clusters, which are followed by small, fleshy fruits.
